column1: 9C6F8DBD-892E-4397-8B00-636C44045961#appfire#B9A8893C-59A0-470A-8CBC-B496C64E5F7F#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-16 12:43:37#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-16 12:43:37#appfire#1

column1: B4AAA00E-08C3-4FD6-A08F-9F2BAFF23251#appfire#B9A8893C-59A0-470A-8CBC-B496C64E5F7F#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-16 12:43:37#appfire#\N#appfire#2015-12-16 12:43:37#appfire#1
